newsitem.title: USA: Dupont forecasts higher third-quarter profits.
newsitem.headline: Dupont forecasts higher third-quarter profits.

text.p: DuPont Co. stock rose Thursday after the big chemical company said its third-quarter profits would be higher than Wall Street estimates.

DuPont shares added $1.50 to $88.625 in late morning trading on the New York Stock Exchange after it said it expected earnings per share for the quarter, excluding non-recurring items, to be at least 10 percent above analysts' average estimate of about $1.45 a share.
"Strong results in the company's upstream petroleum operations are the major factor in this improved outlook," Chief Executive John A. Krol said in a statement.

DuPont, which plans to report its third-quarter earnings on Oct. 23, said petroleum segment results were expected to exceed last year's third quarter by more than 40 percent, mainly due to higher worldwide crude oil prices.
The company, the nation's largest chemical company, also said a number of chemicals and specialities businesses were expected to contribute to this improvement, most notably agricultural products.

DuPont, which is based in Wilmington, Del., also said it would take a non-recurring after-tax charge of about $50 million, or 9 cents a share, for crop damage claims and legal expenses related to the recall of its Benlate 50 DF fungicide.
